function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Tendency in the current body of research to suggest that schools and daycare centers are not seen as drivers of covid-19 caseloads","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Cross-regional spread of infections due to schools and childcare","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Nursing homes as hotspots of covid-19 dissemination","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spillover effects between neighboring districts leading to a containment effect on neighboring regions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Export of infections across regional borders","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interdependent infection channels at the population level","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reversal of protective effects at the population level","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Possible influence of other health variables, such as specialist density or development of hospital care over the last 5 years, had practically no impact on our results.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear unobserved positive rate among asymptomatic children","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent use of research evidence in informing decisions","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Top-down approach to decision-making with political and economic considerations taking precedence over research and health directives","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid spread of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tension between rigor and speed may lead to the dissemination of unverified or non-scientific evidence.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Relevant evidence may exist but decision-makers may be unaware or unable to interpret or apply it to their own context.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decision-makers are influenced by numerous forces, including institutional constraints, political context, interest group pressures, and personal convictions.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infodemics and fake news spreading at an unprecedented speed and reach, making it challenging to find trustworthy sources and reliable information.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cross-sectoral dialogue and collaboration, leading to siloed approaches in public health crisis response.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordinated multi-sectoral actions to mitigate public health crisis impact","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of monitoring the effectiveness of prevention and mitigation measures during a crisis","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited capacity for evidence-informed policy-making in middle-income countries","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of trust in evidence and critical linkages between stakeholders","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid response service may deliver low-quality evidence due to time constraints and urgency, leading to incorrect decision-making.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility and capability in kt platforms to switch to rapid response mode during a crisis.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient resources and funding for operationalizing the rapid response service, leading to delays and inadequacies in evidence provision.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to educate and raise awareness in vulnerable groups about covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of responsiveness to changing priorities and needs","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to identify context-specific knowledge gaps and priorities","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of vigilance in monitoring changes in the health system and social media","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clarity on roles and responsibilities for pandemic response","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure of top-down approach in achieving desired impact for covid-19","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Scarcity of research and scientific uncertainties during pandemics","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on single case studies and observational studies as best available evidence","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on indirect evidence from related viruses like influenza, sars, and ebola for policy response","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on non-peer-reviewed sources for evidence","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of coordination and integration of research, data, and expertise across stakeholders and sectors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficient dissemination of evidence to target audiences","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Proliferation of misinformation and fake news on social media platforms during pandemics","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak collaboration among relevant stakeholders in disseminating evidence during pandemics","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Scarcity of relevant research and actionable evidence during pandemics","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited utilization of evidence in decision-making in low and middle-income countries.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor communication between researchers and decision-makers.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Isolation of infected patients in homes","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close interaction in public places after the end of quarantine","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Home quarantine creating social and psychological challenges due to long stays at home and isolation","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of effective treatment for newly emerging infectious diseases such as covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"History of epidemics driving housing reforms and urban regeneration","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased risk of viral spread within homes due to prolonged periods spent indoors with family members and limited ventilation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate living space and facilities for remote work and study, leading to increased stress and reduced productivity.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate quarantine facilities within homes for infected individuals, leading to increased risk of transmission within the household.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding in public areas of multi-story apartment buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
